required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Clinical Trial of CT0181 Cells in the Treatment of Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Dose Escalation/Dose Exploration, Phase I Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Single/Multiple Infusion of CT0181 Injection in Patients With Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase I Clinical Study of CT0181 cells in Patients with Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objectives:
Evaluate the safety and tolerance of CT0181 cells in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma within 28 days after the first infusion
Secondary objectives:
Evaluate the metabolic kinetics of CT0181 cells ; Evaluate overall safety and tolerability ; Evaluate the initial efficacy of CT0181 cell infusion in the treatment of advanced hepatocellular carcinoma with positive Glypican-3（GPC3 ）expression.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 5 dose levels each with or without lymphocyte clearance were tentatively determined.
arm_group.description: CT0181 Cells were transfused after lymphocyte clearance with fludarabine and cyclophosphamide or without lymphocyte clearance.

intervention.description: 5 dose levels each with or without lymphocyte clearance were tentatively determined.
intervention.arm_group_label: 5 dose levels each with or without lymphocyte clearance were tentatively determined.
intervention.other_name: CT0181 humanized anti GPC3 autogenous T Cell injection
